metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20333 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Sending specially crafted commands to a MongoDB Server may result in artificial log entries being generated or for log entries to be split. This issue affects MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.20; MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.21; MongoDB Server v4.2 versions prior to 4.2.10;

criterions.comment: mongodb: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
